results.title: Each one is different
results.brief_description: This film is designed to show how individual differences in children can be catered for in a primary school. The film is basically relevant to physical education programs.

results.title: Dynasties
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Tim Clark and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Using rare archival footage, photographs and interviews, we are privy to family life and relationships of seven of Australia’s most powerful families. Nineteenth and twentieth century Australian history has been formed by some of the influence of these families - pastoralists, philanthropists, politicians and journalists - and some of their influence on society continues today. Families are: Murdoch, Downer, Wright, Myer, Durack, De Bortolis, and Macarthur. Two-disc set containing seven episodes from Series One of this fascinating ABC TV Documentary series. Narrated by William Zappa.

results.title: Dustbins in the sky
results.creator_credit: Mike Lockey, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Made for the television program “Perspective”, this documentary examined the growth of technology in the collection, transmission and dissemination of news, from early cinema newsreels to today’s satellite coverage.

results.title: Dust to dust
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a small town in northern NSW and the effects of asbestos mining there. The people estimate that three-quarters of the workers have died or are sick from exposure to asbestos. In presenting their story the film raises issues regarding occupational health in general.

results.title: Durer and the renaissance
results.brief_description: Part of the Art History series, describes the life and work of Albrecht Durer, German painter and engraver, and his part in connecting the artistic development in Italy with that of northern Europe.

results.title: Duplex
results.creator_credit: Michaela French, David Price and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Two elderly neighbours Elsie (Esme Melville) and Dora (Margaret Ricketts) are isolated by the limitations that their old age brings. Both are lonely but fail to strike up a friendship as personal obstacles like pride get in the way. Slowly, slowly, Elsie’s determination breaks Dora’s stubborn resistance and the two begin anew as friends. Written, directed and edited by Michaela French.

results.title: Drugs: a primary film
results.brief_description: Presents vignettes of situations familiar to children to explore the correct use of drugs by the doctor and at home. Reveals the danger of drug misuse and emphasises the positive attitudes needed for a rich and healthy life. Suitable for upper primary level.
